Key Match Events: The Knicks were held to their lowest point total of the season in their season-high third straight loss.
Orlando avoided a four-game sweep by winning the final meeting, keeping the lead in the all-time series at 68-66.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Magic don't let their offensive problems affect their defensive intensity, and those offensive problems should ease up once they get some bodies back.
A team that averages nearly 118 points could never sustain a good flow without Towns, as the Magic's size forced the Knicks to use Jericho Sims, who isn't an offensive threat.
Others: Cole Anthony scored 24 points for the Magic.
Wendell Carter Jr. had a season-high 19 points off the bench for the Magic.
Kentavious Caldwell-Pope added 15 points for the Magic.
Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges each scored 24 points for the Knicks.
